abstract: The top stories across India on Thursday are reported and interpreted by the Indian press.
snippet: The top stories across India on Thursday are reported and interpreted by the Indian press.
lead_paragraph: Top leaders of the Congress Party are questioning one of the United Progressive Alliance government's most significant achievements of its last term, the Right to Information Act. Salman Kurshid, India's law minister, advocates amending the popular RTI act to prevent it from misuse that is affecting "institutional efficacy and efficiency." The law, which allows citizen scrutiny of almost all government functions, has often been the target of efforts to limit its authority. (Indian Express)India's army chief sounded the alarm over 4,000 Chinese construction workers, including some combat engineers from the People's Liberation Army, in the portion of Kashmir controlled by Pakistan. India has asked China to stop working on infrastructure projects inside Pakistan-controlled Kashmir, the Times of India reports. The warm relationship between Pakistan and China worries India, which fears being encircled by China and its allies.
